    Class
    Description
    AvoidingThreadDeadlock
    Class demonstrates a example of code which may result in a deadlock This code results in a deadlock because both methods call and callMe are synchronized, which means that only one thread can execute the synchronized code at a time.
    ClassForShutdownHook
    class that will be used to demonstrate the shutdown hook
    MyRunnable

    Class demonstates one of the way of creating a thread (by extending the Thread class) and also the thread priority

    Reentrant
    Class demonstrates the java reentrant monitor In this class m and n are synchronized methods, and m internally calls the n mehtod
    ReentrantLockExample
    Class demonstrates the use of reentrant lock In this example, a ReentrantLock is used to ensure that increments of the count variable are thread-safe.
    Table
    Class that demonstrates the usage of unsychronized threads

    Class demonstrates the process of working with threads
    ThreadSynchronization
    Class demonstrates the different ways of thread synchronization, like synchronized blocks(methods) and reentrant lock
    TryThreadCommunication
    class demonstrates communication between threads when counting even and odd numbers (using synchronized block and reentrant lock)
    WorkerThread
    The WorkerThread class implements the Runnable interface.
